name: Children that died before 5 years of age per woman - based on Gapminder (2015)
title: Children that died before 5 years of age per woman - based on Gapminder (2015)
description:
Child mortality is the probability that a child born in a specific year will die before reaching the age of five if subject to current age-specific mortality rates.
Child mortality was multiplied by fertility to obtain the data on how many children died on average per woman.

sources.name: Children that died before 5 years of age per woman - based on Gapminder (2015)
sources.dataPublishedBy: This data was calculated by Max Roser based on fertility and child mortality estimates from 1800 to 2015 published by Gapminder.org
sources.dataPublisherSource: The two Gapminder.org datasets used were: Gapminder child mortality estimates version 8, Gapminder Total Fertility Rate estimates version 6
sources.additionalInfo:
Child mortality is the probability that a child born in a specific year will die before reaching the age of five if subject to current age-specific mortality rates.
Child mortality was multiplied by fertility to obtain the data on how many children died on average per woman.

fields.name: Children that died before 5 years of age per woman (based on Gapminder (2015))
fields.description: Children that died before 5 years of age per womanTo calculate this measure the total fertility rate was multilplied by the child mortality rate.
